// In your AdapterClass
public class AdapterClass {
    private SQLiteDatabase database;
    private DatabaseHelper dbHelper;

    public AdapterClass(Context context) {
        dbHelper = new DatabaseHelper(context);
    }

    public void open() throws SQLException {
        database = dbHelper.getWritableDatabase();
    }

    public Cursor query(String table, String[] columns, String selection, String[] selectionArgs, String groupBy, String having, String orderBy) {
        return database.query(table, columns, selection, selectionArgs, groupBy, having, orderBy);
    }
}

// In your MainActivity
public class MainActivity extends AppCompatActivity {
    private AdapterClass adapter;

    @Override
    protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
        setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);

        adapter = new AdapterClass(this);
        adapter.open();

        Cursor cursor = adapter.query("CUS_REGISTER", null, "CUS_NAME=? AND CUS_PHONE=?", new String[] { "name", "phone" }, null, null, null);
        if (cursor != null && cursor.moveToFirst()) {
            // Do something with the data
        }
        cursor.close();
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In your AdapterClass, you need to create a method that opens the database and another method that performs the query. In your MainActivity, you need to create an instance of your AdapterClass, open the database, and then perform the query. The query method takes several parameters: the table name, the columns to return (null for all), the selection criteria, the selection arguments, and optional group by, having, and order by clauses.
